trans-unit.source: Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Explains the Automated Backup feature for SQL Server running in Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Explains the Automated Backup feature for SQL Server running in Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup automatically configures <link><linkText>Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for all existing and new databases on an Azure VM running SQL Server 2014 Standard or Enterprise.
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup automatically configures <link><linkText>Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for all existing and new databases on an Azure VM running SQL Server 2014 Standard or Enterprise.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to configure regular database backups that utilize durable Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to configure regular database backups that utilize durable Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup relies on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup relies on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: To install and configure the agent, you must have the Azure VM Agent running on the target virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To install and configure the agent, you must have the Azure VM Agent running on the target virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Newer virtual machine gallery images have this option enabled by default, but the Azure VM Agent might be missing on existing VMs.
trans-unit.target: Newer virtual machine gallery images have this option enabled by default, but the Azure VM Agent might be missing on existing VMs.

trans-unit.source: If you are using your own VM image, you will also need to install the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: If you are using your own VM image, you will also need to install the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>VM Agent and Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>VM Agent and Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup Settings
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup Settings

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the options that can be configured for Automated Backup.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the options that can be configured for Automated Backup.

trans-unit.source: The actual configuration steps vary depending on whether you use the Azure Portal or Azure Windows PowerShell commands.
trans-unit.target: The actual configuration steps vary depending on whether you use the Azure Portal or Azure Windows PowerShell commands.

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Range (Default)
trans-unit.target: Range (Default)

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup

trans-unit.source: Enable/Disable (Disabled)
trans-unit.target: Enable/Disable (Disabled)

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables Automated Backup for an Azure VM running SQL Server 2014 Standard or Enterprise.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables Automated Backup for an Azure VM running SQL Server 2014 Standard or Enterprise.

trans-unit.source: Retention Period
trans-unit.target: Retention Period

trans-unit.source: 1-30 days (30 days)
trans-unit.target: 1-30 days (30 days)

trans-unit.source: The number of days to retain a backup.
trans-unit.target: The number of days to retain a backup.

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: Azure storage account (the storage account created for the specified VM)
trans-unit.target: Azure storage account (the storage account created for the specified VM)

trans-unit.source: An Azure storage account to use for storing Automated Backup files in blob storage.
trans-unit.target: An Azure storage account to use for storing Automated Backup files in blob storage.

trans-unit.source: A container is created at this location to store all backup files.
trans-unit.target: A container is created at this location to store all backup files.

trans-unit.source: The backup file naming convention includes the date, time, and machine name.
trans-unit.target: The backup file naming convention includes the date, time, and machine name.

trans-unit.source: Encryption
trans-unit.target: Encryption

trans-unit.source: Enable/Disable (Disabled)
trans-unit.target: Enable/Disable (Disabled)

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables encryption.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables encryption.

trans-unit.source: When encryption is enabled, the certificates used to restore the backup are located in the specified storage account in the same automaticbackup container using the same naming convention.
trans-unit.target: When encryption is enabled, the certificates used to restore the backup are located in the specified storage account in the same automaticbackup container using the same naming convention.

trans-unit.source: If the password changes, a new certificate is generated with that password, but the old certificate remains to restore prior backups.
trans-unit.target: If the password changes, a new certificate is generated with that password, but the old certificate remains to restore prior backups.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Password text (None)
trans-unit.target: Password text (None)

trans-unit.source: A password for encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: A password for encryption keys.

trans-unit.source: This is only required if encryption is enabled.
trans-unit.target: This is only required if encryption is enabled.

trans-unit.source: In order to restore an encrypted backup, you must have the correct password and related certificate that was used at the time the backup was taken.
trans-unit.target: In order to restore an encrypted backup, you must have the correct password and related certificate that was used at the time the backup was taken.

trans-unit.source: Configure Automated Backup in the Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure Automated Backup in the Portal

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure Preview Portal to configure Automated Backup when you create a new SQL Server 2014 Virtual Machine. The following screenshot shows these options under OPTIONAL CONFIGURATION | SQL AUTOMATED BACKUP.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure Preview Portal to configure Automated Backup when you create a new SQL Server 2014 Virtual Machine. The following screenshot shows these options under OPTIONAL CONFIGURATION | SQL AUTOMATED BACKUP.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Automatic Backup configuration in Azure Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Automatic Backup configuration in Azure Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For existing SQL Server 2014 virtual machines, select the Auto backup settings in the Configuration section of the virtual machine properties.
trans-unit.target: For existing SQL Server 2014 virtual machines, select the Auto backup settings in the Configuration section of the virtual machine properties.

trans-unit.source: In the Automated backup window, you can enable the feature, set the retention period, select the storage account, and set encryption.
trans-unit.target: In the Automated backup window, you can enable the feature, set the retention period, select the storage account, and set encryption.

trans-unit.source: This is shown in the following screenshot.
trans-unit.target: This is shown in the following screenshot.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automated Backup Configuration in Azure Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automated Backup Configuration in Azure Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you enable Automated Backup for the first time, Azure configures the SQL Server IaaS Agent in the background.
trans-unit.target: When you enable Automated Backup for the first time, Azure configures the SQL Server IaaS Agent in the background.

trans-unit.source: During this time, the portal will not show that Automated Backup is configured.
trans-unit.target: During this time, the portal will not show that Automated Backup is configured.

trans-unit.source: Wait several minutes for the agent to be installed, configured.
trans-unit.target: Wait several minutes for the agent to be installed, configured.

trans-unit.source: After that the portal will reflect the new settings.
trans-unit.target: After that the portal will reflect the new settings.

trans-unit.source: Configure Automated Backup with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Configure Automated Backup with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: In the following PowerShell example, Automated Backup is configured for an existing SQL Server 2014 VM.
trans-unit.target: In the following PowerShell example, Automated Backup is configured for an existing SQL Server 2014 VM.

trans-unit.source: The New-AzureVMSqlServerAutoBackupConfig command configures the Automated Backup settings to store backups in the Azure storage account specified by the $storageaccount variable.
trans-unit.target: The New-AzureVMSqlServerAutoBackupConfig command configures the Automated Backup settings to store backups in the Azure storage account specified by the $storageaccount variable.

trans-unit.source: These backups will be retained for 10 days.
trans-unit.target: These backups will be retained for 10 days.

trans-unit.source: The Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension command updates the specified Azure VM with these settings.
trans-unit.target: The Set-AzureVMSqlServerExtension command updates the specified Azure VM with these settings.

trans-unit.source: It could take several minutes to install and configure the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: It could take several minutes to install and configure the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: To enable encryption, modify the previous script to pass the EnableEncryption parameter along with a password (secure string) for the CertificatePassword parameter.
trans-unit.target: To enable encryption, modify the previous script to pass the EnableEncryption parameter along with a password (secure string) for the CertificatePassword parameter.

trans-unit.source: The following script enables the Automated Backup settings in the previous example and adds encryption.
trans-unit.target: The following script enables the Automated Backup settings in the previous example and adds encryption.

trans-unit.source: To disable automatic backup, run the same script without the -Enable parameter to the New-AzureVMSqlServerAutoBackupConfig.
trans-unit.target: To disable automatic backup, run the same script without the -Enable parameter to the New-AzureVMSqlServerAutoBackupConfig.

trans-unit.source: As with installation, it can take several minutes to disable Automated Backup.
trans-unit.target: As with installation, it can take several minutes to disable Automated Backup.

trans-unit.source: Disabling and Uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent
trans-unit.target: Disabling and Uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent

trans-unit.source: If you want to disable the SQL Server IaaS Agent for Automated Backup and Patching, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: If you want to disable the SQL Server IaaS Agent for Automated Backup and Patching, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: To uninstall the SQL Server IaaS Agent, use the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: To uninstall the SQL Server IaaS Agent, use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: You can also uninstall the extension using the Remove-AzureVMSqlServerExtension command:
trans-unit.target: You can also uninstall the extension using the Remove-AzureVMSqlServerExtension command:

trans-unit.source: Disabling and uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent does not remove the previously configured Managed Backup settings.
trans-unit.target: Disabling and uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent does not remove the previously configured Managed Backup settings.

trans-unit.source: You should disable Automated Backup before disabling or uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: You should disable Automated Backup before disabling or uninstalling the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: Compatibility
trans-unit.target: Compatibility

trans-unit.source: The following products are compatible with the SQL Server IaaS Agent features for Automated Backup:
trans-unit.target: The following products are compatible with the SQL Server IaaS Agent features for Automated Backup:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 Standard
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 Standard

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 Enterprise
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 Enterprise

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup configures Managed Backup on Azure VMs.
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup configures Managed Backup on Azure VMs.

trans-unit.source: So it is important to <link><linkText>review the documentation for Managed Backup</linkText><title></title></link> to understand the behavior and implications.
trans-unit.target: So it is important to <link><linkText>review the documentation for Managed Backup</linkText><title></title></link> to understand the behavior and implications.

trans-unit.source: You can find additional backup and restore guidance for SQL Server on Azure VMs in the following topic: <link><linkText>Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can find additional backup and restore guidance for SQL Server on Azure VMs in the following topic: <link><linkText>Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A related feature for SQL Server VMs in Azure is <link><linkText>Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A related feature for SQL Server VMs in Azure is <link><linkText>Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Review other <link><linkText>resources for running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Review other <link><linkText>resources for running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
